title: IPL mega auction: How teams stack up after franchises spend Rs 467.95 cr on 72 players
description: The IPL 2025 mega auction witnessed Lucknow Super Giants securing Rishabh Pant for a record-breaking Rs 27 crore, making him the most expensive player in IPL history. Kolkata Knight Riders made a bold move by spending Rs 23.75 crore to retain Venkatesh Iyer. Other significant buys included Shreyas Iyer by Punjab Kings for Rs 26.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: IPL Auction 2025: Who got whom
description: Star wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant on Sunday shattered IPL auction records, fetching a historic Rs 27 crore from Lucknow Super Giants.  Shreyas Iyer also commanded a hefty sum, joining Punjab Kings for Rs 26.75 crore.  The  IPL 2025 mega auction witnessed intense bidding wars, with teams vying for top Indian and international talent in Jeddah.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: Watch: Shinde's selfie moment as 'Ladki Bahins' propel Mahayuti win
author: TOI NEWS DESK

title: IPL 2025 Auction LIVE: Updated Full Team Squads With Retained Players, Player Prices, and Sold List
description: The two-day Indian Premier League (IPL) mega auction concluded on Monday in Jeddah, with all ten franchises finalizing their squads for the upcoming season.  Teams utilized a combined purse of Rs 641.5 crore to fill 204 slots, selecting from a pool of experienced players, promising youngsters, and international stars.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: 'Religious polarisation played role': Sharad Pawar on MVA's 'Maha' setback
description: Following his party's disappointing performance in the Maharashtra assembly elections, Sharad Pawar acknowledged the results were unexpected. He attributed the outcome to high women voter turnout and a need for the opposition alliance to have intensified their efforts. Pawar defended his decision to field candidates against his nephew Ajit Pawar's faction, emphasizing the need for electoral competition within the state.
author: TOI NEWS DESK

title: 'Worst leak in streaming history': Our team is ..., update on ‘Netflix hack’
description: Netflix is investigating a leak of unreleased footage from popular shows like Squid Game, believed to have originated from a security breach at post-production studio Lyuno. The streaming giant is working with Discord to identify the leaker, who allegedly shared copyrighted material, including an unreleased photo from Squid Game season two, on the platform.
author: TOI TECH DESK

title: Protests by ex-PM Imran Khan's party cost Pak's economy PKR 2 billion
description: Imran Khan's PTI party protests in Pakistan have cost the government over PKR 2 billion over the past 18 months, according to Geo News. Damages to public and private property, security expenses, and lost productivity have added to the financial strain on the struggling economy.
author: TOI WORLD DESK

title: IPL Auction 2025: Meet uncapped crorepatis of the opening day
description: Uncapped players stole the show at the IPL 2025 mega auction, sparking bidding wars and securing impressive deals. Rasikh Dar emerged as the most expensive uncapped player, while Naman Dhir and Abdul Samad also attracted significant bids.  The auction highlighted the growing demand for promising young talent in the league.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: Manipur violence: Autopsy reveals injuries on three killed in Jiribam
description: Forensic reports confirmed extensive injuries on three out of six victims, including a three-year-old boy, found dead after a clash between security forces and suspected militants in Manipur's Jiribam district. The victims, belonging to the Meitei community, went missing from a relief camp following the gunfight. Autopsy reports revealed bullet wounds, cuts, and fractures, indicating a brutal attack.
author: TOI NEWS DESK

title: Amazon makes exception for one country in its worldwide back-to-office policy
description: Amazon is offering its German employees the option to work from home up to two days a week, deviating from its global five-day office mandate. This exception comes amidst employee resistance and contrasts with Amazon's stricter stance compared to other tech giants.
author: TOI TECH DESK

title: 'Never claimed BJP would win Jharkhand': Himanta after poll setback
description: BJP expressed concern over alleged infiltration in Jharkhand after recent election results. JMM-led alliance secured victory. BJP leader urged the new government to prioritize identifying and taking action against infiltration. He emphasized the constitutional duty of the government to address the issue. Sarma also called upon BJP legislators to raise concerns about infiltration in the assembly.
author: TOI NEWS DESK

title: RCB IPL 2025 Squad: Full list of players bought and retained by Royal Challengers Bengaluru
description: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) are gearing up for the 18th season of the Indian Premier League (IPL) with a revamped squad. Having retained only Virat Kohli, Rajat Patidar, and Yash Dayal, RCB had a significant INR 83 crore remaining in their purse to acquire new talent at the recent IPL auction in Saudi Arabia.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: Ishan Kishan takes a 26% pay cut, sold to SRH for Rs 11.25 crore
description: Ishan Kishan has been acquired by Sunrisers Hyderabad for Rs 11.25 crore in the IPL 2025 auction after being released by Mumbai Indians. Despite a hefty price tag of Rs 15.25 crore in the previous auction, Kishan was not among Mumbai's retained players. Delhi Capitals and Punjab Kings also showed interest before SRH secured his services.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: Microsoft CEO wants an 'overhaul' at the company: 'This is not about…'
description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has admitted that the company needs a culture change to prioritize security. This comes after several cybersecurity incidents impacted Microsoft. A faulty update caused a global IT outage. A Chinese hacking group exploited vulnerabilities in Microsoft's systems. Microsoft President Brad Smith has taken responsibility for these security lapses.
author: TOI TECH DESK

title: Hemant Soren’s unique appeal after landslide victory in Jharkhand polls
description: Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) leader Hemant Soren, on his way to a second term as Jharkhand's chief minister, requested well-wishers to gift him books instead of bouquets.  Expressing gratitude for the support that led the JMM-led alliance to victory, Soren recalled finding comfort in reading books gifted to him during his time in jail.
author: TOI NEWS DESK

title: Gujarat Titans IPL 2025 Team Squad: Finalised GT team after auction and retained players
description: The Gujarat Titans entered the IPL auction with Rs 69 crore remaining in their purse after retaining key players like Rashid Khan and Shubman Gill.  They have already made significant additions to their squad, securing Kagiso Rabada, Jos Buttler and Mohammed Siraj for a combined Rs 38.75 crore.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: MI IPL 2025 Updated Squad: Complete list of players bought and retained by Mumbai Indians
description: The Mumbai Indians entered the IPL auction in Jeddah with a remaining purse of INR 45 crore. Having retained key players like Jasprit Bumrah, Hardik Pandya, Rohit Sharma, Suryakumar Yadav and Tilak Varma for a combined INR 75 crore, the five-time champions will strategize to fill the remaining slots effectively.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: Jaguar’s new logo: A new era in the luxury electric vehicle market
description: British automaker Jaguar, under Tata Motors, is going all-electric with a fresh logo, branding, and three new EVs by 2026. Aiming for a younger, wealthier clientele, Jaguar emphasizes luxury and originality, moving away from mass-market strategies to compete with Rolls-Royce and Bentley.  The brand will unveil its first electric model at Miami Art Week in December 2024.
author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

title: CSK IPL 2025 Team Squad: Updated players list from auction and retained players
description: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) entered the IPL Auction in Jeddah with Rs 55 crore to finalize their squad. Having already spent INR 65 crore to retain five key players, including MS Dhoni and Ravindra Jadeja, CSK aimed to strategically utilize their remaining budget to acquire new talent.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: KKR break the bank for Venkatesh Iyer, buy him back for Rs 23.75 crore
description: Venkatesh Iyer returns to Kolkata Knight Riders for a record-breaking Rs 23.75 crore at the IPL 2025 auction.  A bidding war erupted between KKR, Lucknow Super Giants, and Royal Challengers Bangalore for the left-handed batsman.  Iyer was instrumental in KKR's championship run last season, making him a highly sought-after player.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: Punjab Kings (PBKS) IPL 2025 Squad: Complete List of Bought Players and Retentions
description: Punjab Kings (PBKS) are gearing up for a powerful run in IPL 2025 with a revamped squad, helmed by new head coach Ricky Ponting. After retaining core players Shashank Singh and Prabhsimran Singh, PBKS strategically utilized their substantial INR 110.5 crore purse during the auction to acquire a formidable lineup.

title: Winter session: Adani row, Manipur in focus during all-party meet

title: 3 killed in clash between mob and cops during UP mosque survey
description: Three people were killed and several injured in Uttar Pradesh during a court-ordered survey of a mosque.  Violence erupted when protesters, disputing the mosque's origins, clashed with police, leading to lathi charges and tear gas deployment.  The incident has heightened communal tensions in the area, prompting strong reactions from political parties.
author: TOI NEWS DESK

title: Bribery case: Why can't US SEC directly summon Adani?
author: TOI NEWS DESK

title: Schools & colleges in Manipur's Imphal Valley, Jiribam to reopen Monday
description: Schools and colleges in Manipur's Imphal Valley and Jiribam district are set to reopen on November 25th after a week-long closure due to violence and unrest. The decision comes as the state grapples with ethnic clashes that have claimed over 220 lives since May.
author: TOI NEWS DESK

title: Pant sold to LSG for Rs 27 crore after battle with RCB, SRH, DC
description: Rishabh Pant etched his name in IPL history books, becoming the priciest player ever as Lucknow Super Giants splurged an unprecedented sum at the Jeddah auction.  Leaving his long-time franchise Delhi Capitals, Pant's aggressive batting prowess and leadership experience ignited a bidding frenzy, ultimately making him the tournament's most expensive acquisition.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: Why NCP thinks Ajit Pawar could be the next Maharashtra CM?
description: Following the Mahayuti alliance's victory in the Maharashtra assembly elections, speculation is swirling around the next chief minister. While NCP leaders hinted at the possibility of Ajit Pawar taking the helm, emphasizing the party's strong performance, BJP members expressed support for former CM Devendra Fadnavis. The BJP emerged as the single largest party within the victorious alliance.
author: TOI NEWS DESK

title: Delhi Capitals IPL 2025 Squad: Updated List of Retained and Bought Players After Auction
description: Delhi Capitals, previously known as the Delhi Daredevils, continue their quest for a maiden Indian Premier League (IPL) title despite consistently featuring top T20 talent over the years.

title: Who is Jay Bhattacharya? Kolkata-born Stanford prof set to lead NIH under Trump
description: Dr Jay Bhattacharya, a Stanford professor, is being considered by President-elect Donald Trump for the role of director of the National Institutes of Health (NIH). Bhattacharya's potential appointment aligns with Trump's health policy direction, as seen with the nomination of Robert F Kennedy Jr as HHS secretary.
author: TOI WORLD DESK

title: Pant is now 'Lucknow ka Nawab': Rs 27 cr IPL deal blows up internet
description: Rishabh Pant was acquired by the Lucknow Super Giants for a record-breaking Rs 27 crore in the IPL auction, surpassing Mitchell Starc's previous record. Despite Delhi Capitals using their Right-to-Match card, LSG ultimately secured Pant with their final bid. This move marks Pant's first time playing for an IPL team other than his hometown team, Delhi.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: Marquee set 2: Teams splurge a whopping Rs 70.5 crore
description: The IPL 2025 auction witnessed intense bidding wars for top players, with teams spending a total of Rs 70.5 crore to acquire six marquee players. Punjab Kings secured Yuzvendra Chahal for Rs 18 crore, while KL Rahul joined Delhi Capitals for Rs 14 crore.

title: Pant's IPL 2025 bidding war: How LSG, RCB, SRH, DC fought for the star!

A fierce bidding war erupted between LSG, Royal Challengers Bangalore, and Sunrisers Hyderabad, pushing the price to unprecedented levels.

title: Chahal sold to Punjab Kings for Rs 18 crore
description: Indian leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal was acquired by Punjab Kings for Rs 18 crore in the IPL 2025 mega auction.  The highest wicket-taker in IPL history previously played for Mumbai Indians, Royal Challengers Bangalore, and Rajasthan Royals.  Chahal is the first Indian bowler to claim 350 T20 wickets and 200 IPL wickets.

title: Will Musk and Ramaswamy reshape US governance? China weighs the threat

title: Marquee set 1: Teams splurge a whopping Rs 110 crore
description: The IPL 2025 auction saw record-breaking bids, with Rishabh Pant becoming the most expensive player ever at Rs 27 crore, joining Lucknow Super Giants. Shreyas Iyer followed closely at Rs 26.75 crore, acquired by Punjab Kings. India’s star wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant fetched a record-breaking Rs 27 crore, moving to Lucknow Super Giants after being with Delhi Capitals since 2016.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: KL Rahul's new IPL team is Delhi Capitals, sold for Rs 14 crore
description: KL Rahul was acquired by Delhi Capitals for a hefty Rs 14 crore at the IPL 2025 mega auction held in Jeddah.  The 32-year-old star batsman, previously with Lucknow Super Giants, entered the auction pool after being released. Rahul's impressive T20 record, including over 7,500 runs, made him a sought-after player.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: Kohli blows kisses to Anushka after scoring century
description: Virat Kohli ended his century drought with a magnificent hundred against Australia on the third day of the first Test in Perth, blowing kisses to his wife, Anushka Sharma, after reaching the milestone. India declared their second innings at 487/6, setting Australia a target of 534 runs.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: Explained: How DC couldn't get Pant, even after using RTM
description: Delhi Capitals lost their star player Rishabh Pant to Lucknow Super Giants in the IPL 2025 Mega Auction. Despite initially using the Right-To-Match card, DC could not match LSG's final bid of Rs 27 crore, ending Pant's long association with the team.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: Congress to demand deputy CM post in Jharkhand? Party responds
description: Following their victory in the Jharkhand assembly elections, the Congress Legislature Party has decided to allow the central leadership to nominate their leader in the state assembly. The Congress secured 16 seats as part of the Hemant Soren-led JMM alliance, which won a comfortable majority.
author: TOI NEWS DESK

title: IPL Salary System Explained: 10 key points you need to know
description: The IPL salary structure for cricket players involves multi-crore deals paid per season, with the entire amount belonging to the player. Salaries are now denominated in INR, and retained players often receive raises. While players are entitled to full salaries even if unavailable, pro-rata payments apply for partial availability.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: Shreyas Iyer sold to PBKS for Rs 26.75 crore
description: Shreyas Iyer was acquired by Punjab Kings for a record Rs 26.75 crore at the IPL 2025 auction, making him the second most expensive player in IPL history.  Released by KKR, the former captain led them to victory in 2024.  Iyer's impressive recent form in domestic cricket and his history of strong performances in the IPL contributed to his high valuation.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: Video: Gulal catches fire during celebrations for newly-elected independent MLA
description: Newly elected independent MLA Shivaji Patil narrowly escaped injury after vermilion powder ignited upon contact with a ceremonial lamp in Mahagaon village. The incident occurred during a victory celebration, resulting in minor burns for some supporters. Patil confirmed his safety and assured medical assistance for those affected.
author: TNN

title: Explained: Why KKR didn't use RTM for Shreyas Iyer
description: Kolkata Knight Riders opted not to use their Right to Match card for Shreyas Iyer during the IPL 2025 auction due to prior retention decisions. Despite a hefty bidding war, KKR could not match Punjab Kings' winning bid of Rs 26.75 crore, marking a significant loss for the team.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK

title: 1st Test: Virat, Yashasvi bury Australian hopes in Perth
description: India dominated Day 3 of the first Test against Australia in Perth, setting a commanding target of 534 runs. Yashasvi Jaiswal and KL Rahul's opening stand of 201, followed by Virat Kohli's century, propelled India to 487/6 declared. Jasprit Bumrah then ripped through Australia's top order, leaving them reeling at 12/3 at stumps.
author: TOI SPORTS DESK
